item.title: Differentiable Particle Filtering via Entropy-Regularized Optimal Transport
item.description: On Thursday the \(29^{\text{th}}\) of April, Mauro presented Differentiable Particle Filtering via Entropy-Regularized Optimal Transport by Corenflos et al.Â You can find the abstract below. Particle Filtering (PF) methods are an established class of procedures for performing inference in non-linear state-space models. Resampling is a key ingredient of PF, necessary to obtain low variance likelihood and states estimates. However, traditional resampling methods result in PF-based loss functions being non-differentiable with respect to model and PF parameters.
